We demonstrated that patients with abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) show increased protein levels of the dsDNA sensor AIM2 in peripheral monocytes, granulocytes, T cells, and B cells, compared with controls. Moreover, our data present evidence that PBMC of AAA patients respond to foreign DNA with higher inflammasome activation and IL-1beta release than PBMC from patients without AAA.

In the hypopharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma (HSCC) samples, low AIM2 expression was closely related to lymph node metastasis and intravascular tumor thrombus and were strongly associated with poor survival. AIM2 expression was negatively correlated with pSTAT3 expression in the HSCC tissue samples, and combined analysis revealed that patients with low AIM2 and high pSTAT3 levels had the worst survival rate.

summary: AIM2 is a member of the IFI20X /IFI16 family.  It plays a putative role in tumorigenic reversion and may control cell proliferation.  Interferon-gamma induces expression of AIM2. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
